newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down after wide fluctuations.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down after wide fluctuations.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended slightly down on Tuesday as profit-taking wiped off early gains.
Dealers said investors were uncertain about how the Supreme Court will rule on ousted prime minister Benazir Bhutto's plea for reinstatement. The decision is expected on Wednesday.

According to final figures, the Karachi 100-share index ended 1.32 points, or 0.09 percent, down at 1,500.84, after rising to 1,522.61 earlier. Gainers led losers 173 to 47 in a turnover of 35 million shares, up from Monday's 24.8 million.
